latestVersion.disclaimer: This study is provided AS-IS.  While every effort was made to correctly package and present the data, we make no guarantee to this effect.  Please contact Greg Snyder with any questions/problems.

fields.value: Replication data for: Modeling Mid-Infrared Diagnostics of Obscured Quasars and Starbursts

dsDescriptionValue.value: This study contains simulated spectral energy distributions and derived quantities, such as mid-infrared diagnostics and star formation rates and SMBH accretion rates, from a sample of high-resolution hydrodynamical galaxy merger simulations presented by Snyder et al. 2013, ApJ, 768, 168 ; http://arxiv.org/abs/1210.6347.  This paper sought to validate commonly used mid-infrared diagnostics of starburst versus AGN activity.  This paper also derives and studies an idealized combination of mid-infrared diagnostics, accessible to the James Webb Space Telescope, that may estimate the SMBH luminosity as robustly as hard X-ray luminosity.  The data are presented in a multi-unit FITS-format file, with a full description given in the README.txt file included with the study.  Please contact Greg Snyder with questions or if you notice a problem.

keywordValue.value: active galactic nuclei, starburst, mid-infrared, infrared, James Webb Space Telescope, quasar, radiative transfer, numerical simulations, galaxy mergers

publicationCitation.value: Snyder, G.F., Hayward, C.C., Sajina, A., Jonsson, P., Cox., T.J., Hernquist, L., Hopkins, P., Yan, L., Astrophysical Journal, 2013, 768, 168

files.description: Data file This is a FITS file with 8 HDUs total. In addition to the primary HDU of type Image, it contains 7 Image HDU(s);  The following recognized metadata keys have been found in the FITS file, and their values will be made searchable in the DVN, once the study has been indexed:  EXTNAME;
